snippet: A weapons convoy believed to be from Islamic State fighters seized in an area devastated by Boko Haram raises alarm that the two are working to attack U.S. allies in Africa.
abstract: United States military officials warn Boko Haram and Islamic State group have started collaborating more closely, pointing to weapons convoy, believed to have been sent by Islamic State in Libya to Boko Haram fighters in Chad, that was halted at border; warning comes as US ambassador to United Nations Samatha Power is meeting with top officials in Chad, including Pres Idriss Deby.
lead_paragraph: A weapons convoy believed to be from Islamic State fighters seized in an area devastated by Boko Haram raises alarm that the two are working to attack U.S. allies in Africa.

headline.main: Boko Haram and ISIS Are Collaborating More, U.S. Military Says
headline.print_headline: Boko Haram and ISIS Are Collaborating More, U.S. Military Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
